review_blob:
A tasty filling beer that fits a cold winter night well for a belgian inspired blonde.

Opens with a pop and pours lively with a big fluffy head that has good retention and leaves a lot of lace.

Looks cloudy once the carbonation wears off and even with the yeast dumped into a shot glass there is some sediment swirling around.

The aroma has a an off grapefruit smell and caramel. 

Mouthfeel reminds me of seeking good flavor in a plump cloud. Long lasting and filling but surprisingly tasty with banana and caramel combos.
This beer is unique and the only fault is that I did not get the beer before the sell by date had been reached...

Tried this beer fresh in the brewery in the trademarked excelsior class, which I ended up purchasing, and drank it on a tour - no better way to experience a craft beer. The atmosphere enhanced the beer. Had a hazy body and appearance and the beer was lively overall a pure white head after the bartender scooped some off. Had a citrus aroma and taste with some slight hints of spice.
